title: Drawing, "Stage Design: Composition of Antique Buildings and Ruins, Unfinished", 1775–90
medium: Pen and black and brown ink, brush and gray wash, pink and yellow watercolor, graphite on thick white laid paper,  ruled border in pen and brown ink
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee, Brookline, MA
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Horizontal drawing of a stage desgin.  In the middle a domed building  with sculptural decoration or trefoil form ground plans.  On either side antique buildings, in the foreground ruins; in unfinished state.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Stage Design: Composition of Antique Buildings and Ruins, Unfinished", 1775–90.
1775–90. Pen and black and brown ink, brush and gray wash, pink and yellow watercolor, graphite on thick white laid paper,  ruled border in pen and brown ink. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-12.
